entry.title: Tribe to seek community input for downtown property development
entry.summary: In June 2024, the Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians purchased 464 SE Jackson St. for $1,043,817. The purchase brought a chance to turn the run-down and vacant property into a fresh opportunity for economic growth, but the…

entry.title: Glide Elementary students take the lead
entry.summary: Ten sixth-grade students were called into the principal’s office. They weren’t in trouble. Instead, they were invited to share their thoughts, take turns speaking and listen to each other as school administrators leaned in to hear what they had to…

entry.title: Accreditation matters: Wildlife Safari steps up amid game park crisis
entry.summary: WINSTON — Zoos give ticket holders a front row seat to the wild. What isn’t covered with the fair however is the complex web of factors maintaining the organization — from financials to conservation, there’s more beyond the enclosures.

entry.title: Roseburg Set to See Hottest Day of 2025 So Far Today
entry.summary: Roseburg is expected to hit near 90 degrees Friday - making it the hottest day of 2025 so far. The National Weather Service says highs will be 15 - 20 degrees above normal. A gradual cooldown is expected over the weekend.

entry.title: Unstoppable: The Class of 2025
entry.summary: If you’ve driven north of exit 129 lately, you’ve seen it: Umpqua Community College’s bold new billboard, featuring a proud Riverhawk graduate and a single word -“Unstoppable.” That’s not just a slogan. It’s a mindset. It’s a promise we make…

entry.summary: During her freshman year at Roseburg High School, Emily Gibbons said she only passed three of her 14 classes.

entry.title: Just stick it out: Scotlynn Winter changes her tune in time to graduate
entry.summary: It wasn’t until junior year that Scotlynn Winter realized she actually wouldn’t be graduating Roseburg High School alongside her peers in the class of 2025 if she continued her habits.

entry.summary: May 27, 2025 3:05 a.m. Roseburg Public Library has its Summer Reading Program for children and teens beginning on June 1st. The program will continue through Saturday August 23rd. That is 12 weeks and equates to 57 programs, hundreds of reading prizes, 290 craft kits every week, numerous outreach events, and extra summer volunteers and...

entry.title: MERKLEY, WYDEN, HOYLE PUSH FOR FEDERAL DISASTER DECLARATION
entry.summary: May 27, 2025 2:50 a.m. Oregon’s U.S. Senators Jeff Merkley and Ron Wyden, alongside U.S. Representative Val Hoyle are calling for swift approval of Governor Tina Kotek’s request for a Major Disaster Declaration from the Federal Emergency Management Agency. A joint release said the push comes in response to devastating flood and other damaging weather-related...
